      <vocabularyID>LRE.expressionDescriptionFacetValues</vocabularyID>

    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oai</catalog>

          </identifier>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>lre</catalog>
            <entry>cahi1:data_79790</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">Thermal decomposition of carbonates</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Thermische Aufspaltung der Karbonate</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Décomposition thermique des carbonates</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Decomposition térmico dos carbonatos</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Decomposizione termica dei carbonati</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Θερμική αποσύνθεση των ανθρακικών αλάτων</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Descomposición termal de carbonatos</string>
          </title>
          <description>
            <string language="en">This illustration shows that carbonates such as copper carbonate and zinc carbonate split up into carbon dioxide and their respective oxides when heated.</string>
          </description>
          <language>x-none</language>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Carbon dioxide</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">chemical reactions</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">compounds</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">copper carbonate</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">copper oxide</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">gases</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">heat</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">pyrolysis</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">solids</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">thermal decomposition</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">zinc carbonate</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">zinc oxide</string>
          </keyword>
          <structure>
            <source>structureValues</source>
            <value>atomic</value>
          </structure>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Diese Abbildung zeigt daß Karbonate wie kupfernes
Karbonat und Zinkkarbonat, die oben in Kohlendioxyd und in ihre 
jeweiligen Oxide, wenn sie aufgespaltet wird erhitzt wird.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Cette illustration prouve que les carbonates tels
que le carbonate de cuivre et le carbonate de zinc fractionnent dans 
l'anhydride carbonique et leurs oxydes respectifs une fois de 
chauffage.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Esta ilustração mostra que carbonatos tais como 
o carbonato de cobre e o carbonato do zinco rachados acima no dióxido
de carbono e em seus óxidos respectivos quando aquecida.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Questa illustrazione indica che i carbonati quali 
carbonato di rame ed il carbonato dello zinco scindono nell'anidride 
carbonica e nei loro ossidi rispettivi una volta riscaldati.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Αυτή η απεικόνιση δείχνει ότι τα ανθρακικά άλατα 
όπως το ανθρακικό άλας χαλκού και το ανθρακικό άλας ψευδάργυρου
χωρίζουν στο διοξείδιο του άνθρακα και τα αντίστοιχα οξείδιά 
τους όταν θερμαίνονται.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Esta ilustración muestra que los carbonatos 
tales como carbonato de cobre y carbonato del cinc se dividen en el 
bióxido de carbono y sus óxidos respectivos cuando están 
calentados.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>

          </keyword>
